gettingStartedStep1Desc: This project is available through npm. To install run:
gettingStartedStep1Note: Requires npm@3 and node@6 or above, tested on OSX & Linux, expected to work on Windows.
gettingStartedStep3Desc: In order to use js-ipfs as a CLI, you must install it with the global flag. Run the following (even if you have ipfs installed locally):
gettingStartedStep3Note: The CLI is available by using the command jsipfs in your terminal. This is aliased, instead of using ipfs, to make sure it does not conflict with the Go implementation.
gettingStartedStep4Desc:
Learn how to bundle with browserify and webpack in the examples folder.

You can also load it using a <script> using the unpkg CDN or the jsDelivr CDN. Inserting one of the following lines will make a Ipfs object available in the global namespace.
gettingStartedStep4Note: Inserting one of the above lines will make an Ipfs object available in the global namespace.
